ea76fd02-0666-485b-b725-8f920a6b8897.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they can confidently and competently apply the coach approach, aligned to the ICF Core Competencies, to their individual clients. With a focus on leadership and performance, earners help their clients build greater awareness of their impact and help them make choices that serve their values and purpose.
ea76fd02-0666-485b-b725-8f920a6b8897.name: Leadership and Performance Coaching Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

alignments.name: Associate Certified Coach
alignments.description: This program provides accredited education in preparation for the International Coaching Federation ACC credential through the ACSTH Path.

badge_template_activities.title: ACT’s Leadership & Performance Coach Training Certification Program is a six-month program, with three live experiential sessions supplemented with online group and individual learning. In-person sessions are held on the Brown University campus in Providence, Rhode Island.

9bab93e0-cc56-46c7-a7e4-630cedb13261.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they can competently conduct coach-like conversations within their organizations. Earners can apply their coach-like skills to different types of conversations (i.e. mentoring, giving feedback, performance reviews, etc.) and to a range of organizational contexts.
9bab93e0-cc56-46c7-a7e4-630cedb13261.name: Leader as Coach Program

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: The Leader as Coach program includes four live online sessions led by two instructors and a robust asynchronous curriculum to help develop you as a coach-like leader. The program spans over eight weeks. The program delivery approach utilitizes the observe, practice, reflect, apply and integrate model.

eee97ad3-2680-433e-8569-40d363368e16.description: Foundations is a 10-session class that investigates experiential learning and the MBSR curriculum. Through exploring one’s personal encounter with meditation practice, the MBSR class, and class dynamics, trainees delve into the very personal nature of mindfulness practice and begin to cultivate teacher qualities and competencies that form the foundation of understanding the essence of MBSR and experiential teaching.
eee97ad3-2680-433e-8569-40d363368e16.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction(MBSR) Foundations

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 2 synchronous online sessions per week that meet over ten weeks totaling 6 hours per week.

299056f3-f31e-4721-8f8d-3c17a63b986f.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they can confidently and competently apply the team coaching approach, aligned to the ICF Team Coaching Competencies, to their client teams. With a focus on team empowerment, high performance and achieving results, earners help their client teams build greater awareness of their impact and align to their overall values and purpose.
299056f3-f31e-4721-8f8d-3c17a63b986f.name: Team Coaching Program

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

alignments.name: ICF Continuing Coach Education (CCE) Credits
alignments.description: Earners of this designation are approved for 40.75 CCEs with the ICF.

badge_template_activities.title: The Team Coaching program is a three-month program, with two live experiential modules supplemented with a team field project and individual learning.

2128482e-7d42-43d5-bafe-91b1b1b90f94.description: The Teacher Advancement Intensive(TAI) offers trainees opportunities to strengthen teaching skills, deepen personal practice, and investigate the nature of stress, challenge, and resilience, in all the ways it arises in life, within the context of a supportive and thoughtful learning community. Exploration builds on the roots of MBSR Foundations and the MBSR curriculum, nurturing proficiency in didactic presentations, dialogue and inquiry, and guiding mindfulness meditation practices.
2128482e-7d42-43d5-bafe-91b1b1b90f94.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction(MBSR) Teacher Advancement Intensive

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: This program meets for three, three-day sessions for a total of 9 days over a period of 1-2 months as a live-online program totaling 82 hours. Successful completion of this course also designates the earner as a Qualified Level One MBSR Teacher.

skills.name: Identify and Discuss Foundations of MBSR

ff1fd40a-0c76-49d2-a1fd-d6c3e1b8ebd3.description: This program covers four topics, Buddhist Principle & Contemplative Methodologies, Experiential Education & Group Process, Mindfulness of Inclusion, Diversity, Identity, and Trauma, The Science of MBSR. While these are not explicitly drawn out in the MBSR classroom, they serve as nourishing streams supporting teachers in trusting the capacity of adult learning, the power of contemplative awareness practices as innate capacities, and highlight contemporary issues of equity, diversity, and trauma.
ff1fd40a-0c76-49d2-a1fd-d6c3e1b8ebd3.name: Ethos of Mindfulness-Based Programs

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Course participants attend 10-sessions covering the (4) elements of focus that underpin and frame Mindfulness-Based Programs

48db4b1f-5c88-4650-8655-aff6af1195ea.description: For MBSR teachers, the dialogue and inquiry that arises in the classroom invites the practice of mindfulness into the sphere of reflecting, listening, and speaking. This practice—between the teacher and individual participants, as well as connecting individual experiences to the group, draws from the traditions of contemplative practice—including the natural interest and curiosity that arises with meditation practice—as well as Western traditions of investigation.
48db4b1f-5c88-4650-8655-aff6af1195ea.name: Dialogue & Inquiry for Mindfulness-Based Programs

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Course participants attend five 2-hour sessions.

skills.name: Develop Dialogue & Inquiry Skills in Small Groups
Examine the Ethos of Relationality in MBSR
Further Relate to and Practice Dialogic Methodologies and Applications
Increase Comprehension of the Mindfulness-Based Interventions Teaching Assessment Criteria

cd41e35a-0a94-4d1b-a176-b73575caae86.description: Level One Qualified Teachers have successfully completed the MBSR Foundations and MBSR Teacher Advancement Intensive. Through the investigation of the MBSR curriculum, they have studied the essence of experiential learning and the underpinnings and science of MBSR. A Qualified Teacher at this level has shown proficiency in didactic presentations, dialogue and inquiry, and guided mindfulness meditation practice.
cd41e35a-0a94-4d1b-a176-b73575caae86.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction(MBSR) Qualified Teacher Level One

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 270 student hours over multiple sessions. Attended the MBSR Foundations and MBSR Teacher Advancement Intensive. As well as taught three introductory mindfulness sessions, and attended an instructor-led silent retreat,

skills.name: Identify and Discuss Foundations of MBSR

3daa2e3a-f671-4881-ac9d-3e9cb8f3e5e4.description: This interactive and intensive online five-week program will transform how you communicate. Through live sessions with Brown's renowned faculty member Dr. Barbara Tannenbaum, practice in teams and individualized coaching from experts, you will build on your strengths to dramatically improve your communication skills in every scenario: one-on-one, small groups, large audiences — both live and online. Each week, you will apply key concepts from the course in your own work in real-time.
3daa2e3a-f671-4881-ac9d-3e9cb8f3e5e4.name: Powerful and Persuasive Communication

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend synchronous online sessions over four weeks.

8afda089-69c3-431d-8d40-8041b12f424f.description: Designed to uniquely support each teacher’s needs, the course invites each participant-teacher to identify the meditation practices, didactic presentations and teaching domains that they wish to focus on and deepen. Together we investigate the intentions and components of various curricular elements. We also explore pedagogical issues, MBI:TAC domains, teacher qualities and teaching as a practice—as vital and alive as one’s personal meditation practice.
8afda089-69c3-431d-8d40-8041b12f424f.name: MBSR Curriculum Study Group & Skill Building

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Meeting for two hours a week, for eight weeks, a small cohort of new MBSR teachers engage with a teacher-trainer.

ba11f527-f1e8-4a4e-875d-de4c57dbc44d.description: In this highly experiential program, healthcare professionals learn to apply Coach-like skills to a wide range of scenarios. Upon completion, participants will have the tools to create more authentic relationships, empower teams to reach their full potential, and assist others in their journey. Whatever your vantage point, from providing direct patient care to serving as a system-level executive, this program will improve your ability to engage with others and become a multi-dimensional leader.
ba11f527-f1e8-4a4e-875d-de4c57dbc44d.name: Leadership Coaching for Healthcare Professionals

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: The Leadership Coaching for Healthcare Professionals program includes 6 live online instructor-led 2-hour sessions and 1 completion call. The program spans over six weeks and utilizes the observe, practice, reflect, apply and integrate model.

51da6507-cca2-461c-ae7c-cdbd113032f1.description: Foundations of Digital Health Innovation is a 6-week course that enables participants to define characteristics of successful digital health products and analyze the current market to identify opportunities to design and deploy effective and equitable innovations. This is Course 1 of the Digital Health Innovation Certificate, developed by faculty from the Brown School of Public Health, the School of Engineering, The Warren Alpert Medical School, and the Brown-Lifespan Center for Digital Health.
51da6507-cca2-461c-ae7c-cdbd113032f1.name: Foundations of Digital Health Innovation

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 6, 1-hour synchronous sessions and complete about 42 hours of asynchronous work

4f5b4ccc-b165-44dd-8bb4-a721327aac04.description: Digital Health Technology Design is a 6-week course that enables participants to utilize user-centered design, navigate regulatory requirements, and translate desired product attributes into specifications to guide an engineering or software development effort. This is Course 2 of the Digital Health Innovation Certificate, developed by faculty from the Brown School of Public Health, the School of Engineering, The Warren Alpert Medical School, and the Brown-Lifespan Center for Digital Health.
4f5b4ccc-b165-44dd-8bb4-a721327aac04.name: Digital Health Innovation Design

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 6, 1-hour synchronous sessions and complete about 42 hours of asynchronous work

de27fb3e-f0cc-4428-bb00-f03b80d3dd3d.description: Completing the Certificate represents a culmination of formal training programs, teaching, as well as one's personal meditation and retreat experience. Brown University's Certificate in Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction Teaching is a training pathway of 7 courses. Certification acknowledges a teacher’s dedication, knowledge, and skill teaching an MBSR Program
de27fb3e-f0cc-4428-bb00-f03b80d3dd3d.name: Certified MBSR Teacher

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed Level 1 and Level 2 of the MBSR Certification pathway. To earn credentials a submission includes a full set of teaching films of an MBSR program as well as course work, essays, and other recordings.

skills.name: Develop Dialogue & Inquiry Skills in Small Groups
Examine the Ethos of Relationality in MBSR

c41ed419-7ec9-4b67-a54c-f0913402d4d9.description: Digital Health Evaluation and Deployment is a 6-week course that enables participants to evaluate digital health products and strategize funding options to launch safe, equitable, and effective products. This is Course 3 of the Digital Health Innovation Certificate, developed by faculty from the Brown School of Public Health, the School of Engineering, the Warren Alpert Medical School, the Brown-Lifespan Center for Digital Health, and the Digital Medicine Society.
c41ed419-7ec9-4b67-a54c-f0913402d4d9.name: Digital Health Evaluation and Deployment

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 6, 1-hour synchronous sessions and complete about 42 hours of asynchronous work

b91f4769-7f78-449a-a268-80e0b7cdcca0.description: Individual Mentoring is for the experienced MBSR teacher seeking refinement in their teaching skills, attitudes, and perspectives as they move toward Certification. Working with a teacher-mentor, participant meets weekly as they teach the MBSR program, providing reflections and class notes. This dynamic relational process, establishes a safe space for the MBSR teacher to explore teaching challenges, strengths, misunderstandings, and breakthroughs.
b91f4769-7f78-449a-a268-80e0b7cdcca0.name: MBSR Individual Mentoring

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Meets for 10-sessions while actively teaching the 8-week MBSR program. The mentee is invited to investigate curriculum comprehension, relational teaching, approaches to meeting challenges as well as moments of ease and freedom.

58d263d2-a6c0-4ca6-ba39-0eb518503e22.description: This first-level training offers background and rationale of the MBI: TAC domains, and explores its use as a self-reflective, strength-based tool to support a teacher's personal development, self-knowledge, and skill enhancement. In addition, this training introduces many of the issues and practices of using the instrument for self and peer feedback, mentoring, and supervision.
58d263d2-a6c0-4ca6-ba39-0eb518503e22.name: Mindfulness-Based Intervention: Teaching Assessment Criteria Level 1 (MBI:TAC)

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants actively engage with content and peers over 5 weeks of 3-hour seminar work a total of 15 contact hours. Readings and other between-session coursework are also required.

skills.name: Beginning Skill in Giving Formative and Developmental Feedback

a3c23b67-efee-43ae-ac95-4e42b053ebc5.description: During this step of the Training Pathway, students strengthen their teaching skills and focus their practice. Level Two Qualified Teachers have successfully completed; MBSR Curriculum Study Group and Skill-Building Workshop, MBSR Individual Mentoring, Attended the Insight Inside Us retreat, Successfully completed teaching a total of six (6) MBSR programs
a3c23b67-efee-43ae-ac95-4e42b053ebc5.name: Mindfulness-Based Stress Relief(MBSR) Qualified Teacher Level Two

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully attended multiple hours and sessions within the (4) Level 2 Requirements: MBSR Curriculum Study Group and Skill-Building Workshop, MBSR Individual Mentoring, Attended the Insight Inside Us retreat, Successfully completed teaching a total of six (6) MBSR programs

skills.name: Develop Dialogue & Inquiry Skills in Small Groups
Examine the Ethos of Relationality in MBSR

059439bb-c115-41e9-951c-4e16cdbe82bd.description: Digital Health Innovation Capstone is a 6-week course that enables participants to define the value, expected outcomes, and impact of their digital health product by developing an implementation plan and a pitch deck to garner support and funding. This is Course 4 of the Digital Health Innovation Certificate, developed by faculty from the Brown School of Public Health, School of Engineering, the Warren Alpert Medical School, and the Brown-Lifespan Center for Digital Health.
059439bb-c115-41e9-951c-4e16cdbe82bd.name: Digital Health Innovation Capstone

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 6, 1-hour synchronous sessions and complete about 42 hours of asynchronous work

895b3162-a749-4c6f-ae56-a8c84b3e3444.description: Over 4 courses, you will learn from top faculty at Brown University and industry practitioners in engineering, public health, entrepreneurship, and medicine to build a cross-disciplinary approach to digital healthcare innovation. You will build your digital health innovation skills including understanding best practices, understanding the range of existing technology, building frameworks for analyzing market needs and opportunities as well as the ability to evaluate digital innovation products.
895b3162-a749-4c6f-ae56-a8c84b3e3444.name: Digital Health Innovation Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Brown School of Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successful participants attend 6-weekly synchronous hour-long sessions.
